radiographic_examinations.findings: Lung bases are clear. Heart size within normal limits. Normal appearance of the gastroesophageal junction. Mild intrahepatic biliary dilatation and marked extrahepatic biliary dilatation with the common bile duct measuring up to 2.0 cm. The pancreas is symmetrically atrophic. Normal appearance of the spleen, adrenals, kidneys, ureters, and bladder. Small and large bowel are unobstructed. The stomach is distended. Scattered colonic diverticulosis with extensive distal sigmoid diverticulosis, wall thickening, and a pericolonic 3.3 x 6.1 cm abscess. No free air is seen in the abdomen. Osseous structures demonstrate degenerative change without acute or suspicious abnormality. Diffuse osteopenia. Degenerative grade 1 anterolisthesis of L4 on L5. Chronic appearing compression fracture at T12. Left femoral head screw is noted.
